caption.p: Worms were maintained at 15°C and then shifted to 25°C at the L4 larval stage. All the analyses were conducted at 25°C for all the genotypes indicated above. The 'Eggs Laid' column indicates the average number of eggs laid (including both hatched and non-hatched embryos) per P0 hermaphrodite ± standard deviation. % Embryonic lethality was calculated by dividing the number of non-hatched embryos by the total number of hatched and non-hatched embryos laid. % Males was calculated by dividing the total number of males observed by the total number of hatched (viable) progeny scored. N = total number of P0 worms for which entire broods were scored. N.A.= not applicable.
